audio_description: Welcome to T-South Chennai! Today, as many of you requested, I’m going to show you my favorite – Kerala-style Thalassery Chicken Biryani. This biryani is very flavorful and has a rich, traditional taste.

Stirring the mixture with a wooden spatula
Adding clarified butter/oil to the curry
Mixing the curry to incorporate ingredients
Covering the pan with a lid
Submerging shredded potatoes into hot oil
Stirring shredded potatoes with a slotted spoon
Frying bacon or meat in hot oil
Spreading the batter with a spatula
Adding green herbs to the batter
Stirring the batter and herbs with a spatula
Adding the pink substance (butter or ghee) to the mixture
Distributing the rice evenly in the pan
Stirring the mixture with a wooden spoon
Placing a lid on the pot
Adding fried onions (on top of the curry)
Distributing spice powder over the rice using an orange measuring spoon
Pouring a yellow liquid over the rice
Covering the pan with a lid
Stirring (implied from previous action, not visible in specific frames)

Placing the rice and chicken onto a banana leaf
Placing chicken pieces on the biryani rice
Positioning hard-boiled eggs on the side

arranging the boiled eggs and raita

audio_description: Now close the pan and dum for 15–20 minutes. First 5 minutes on high, then 10 minutes low. Then place a dosa tawa under the pot and dum another 10 minutes on low.
